result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William S. Dahl

records.addlTxt: of Plea/Sentencing -- November 9, 2018

15CF-67, 15CF-142, 17CF-120 and 17CF-147 - All Cases Called @ 10:06 AM:  Defendant William S. Dahl in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint Global Resolution/Consolidation recited by DA.  Neither party will be requesting a PSI.  Counsel and Def concur with State's recital.  Counsel prepared to Stipulate to Examiner's Report as to NGI plea.  Court entertains withdrawal of NGI plea with Defendant.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary withdrawal of bifurcated plea of NGP/NGI.  Court entertains joinder of all 4 Waushara Co Cases.  Court entertains consolidation of Waupaca Co Case 17CF-169.  Court will permit joinder of Waushara Co Cases and consolidation of the Waupaca Co Case No. 17CF-169.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary consent for joinder of 15CF-142, 17CF-120 and 17CF-147 into 15CF-67 and consolidation of Waupaca Co Case 17CF-169 - noting the filing of a consent for consolidation by Waupaca Co.  17CF-169 - Complaint Stated -  Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing in its entirety. Court questions defendant and accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of preliminary hearing.  Def BOT.  Amended INFO Filed.  Amended INFO Stated.  Receipt Admitted and Reading Waived.  Defendant intends to plead to 3, 4, 9 and 11 today of Amended INFO.  Counsel and Defendant confirm intended pleas.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of potential punishment w/detailed elements of offenses.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Counsel agree to amendment of Complaint and Amended INFO to add "Intent to Steal" relating to Ct No 11.  Court will permit amendment of both the Complaint and Amended INFO to include element of "Intent to Steal" to the charge.  Collateral consequences explained. DA confirms Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Pleas to Amended INFO:  Plea Ct 3:  NC  Plea Ct 4:  NC   Plea Ct 9:  NC  Plea Ct 11: NC  Court accepts knowing and voluntary pleas and enters JOC to all 4 counts.  Ct Nos 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12 and  13 all DRI of Amended INFO.  DA offers commentary on behalf of victim.  Argument by DA as to Sentencing.  Argument by Atty Belville as to Sentencing.  Statement by Defendant prior to SEH:  Yes.  

The Court:  Will accept joint agreement and will accept resolution in its totality.

As to Ct No. 3:  5 yr bifurcated SEH - 2 yrs IC/3 yrs ES.  503 days of prior time served to be applied to IC.  Terms of ES:  Rest of $899.08 J/S w/co-Defendant J. Schiesel; NC w/victim unless specifically approved by supervising agent; AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Defendant is not to be in possession of any dangerous weapons including any firearms; Complete mental health evaluation and follow thru with any required treatment; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA on file - Surcharge imposed.  

As to Ct No. 4:  S/W - 2 yrs probation - consecutive to 5 yr term of imprisonment as to Ct 3.  Conditions - Same terms of ES as stated for Ct 3.

As to Ct No. 9: Court Costs Only - 60 DTP or PP. 

As to Ct No. 11:  S/W - 5 yr term of probation - concurrent to the period of imprisonment in Ct 3 - meaning at the same time.  Conditions - Same terms of ES as stated for Ct 3.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

12:08 pm cases called-15CF67, 15CF142, 17CF120, & 17CF147. Defendant William S. Dahl in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Laurence Trueman appears by phone. Court goes over the record and the competency report filed. Court questions counsel regarding the report filed by Dr. Trueman. Attorney Belville states the defendant is contesting his competency and there will be a need for testimony. Dr. Trueman sworn by court. DA Anderson questions Dr. Trueman, stipulation between counsel regarding expert testimony of the witness. Further testimony provided by Dr. Trueman. Report received by the court with no objection by Attorney Belville. Attorney Belville questions witness-testimony given. Witness excused. Argument by DA Anderson. Argument by Attorney Belville.  Court makes a statement regarding reports filed and testimony given. Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and finds it appropriate to move foward on their merits recognizing the defendant is competent to assist counsel. Court questions counsel regarding further scheduling. Court directs the preparation of a 971.16 report as previously entered and the Court will appoint another examiner to conduct the evaluation. Bond reinstated.
from DA Anderson asking for telephonic appearance by Dr. Trueman at the competency hearing - Granted by the court
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

10:47 am cases called-15CF67, 15CF142, 17CF120, & 17CF147. Defendant William S. Dahl in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel and court have received competency evaluation filed by Dr. Benson. State stipulates to report of Dr. Benson. Attorney Belville also stipulates to report. Court questions parties regarding order. Court receives Dr. Benson's report and finds based on the report that the defendant is not competent to proceed but finds the defendant may regain competence through the competency restoration program. Court enters an order to the Competency Restoration Program with medication order. Court enters order committing the defendant to a mental health facility identified by the Dept for the purpose of administering care and treatment necessary for restoration to competence and a corresponding involuntary medication order. The committment to the Department is for a period of 12 months-the institution will be designated  by the Department and enters a corresponding medication order for the defendant to regain competence as the court finds the defendant may regain competence within the 12 month statutory time frame. Court finds order entered under 971.14(4)(b) and (5)(a).
Dr. Steven Benson, Dated 11/30/2017

15CF-67 and 15CF-142 - Both Cases Called @ 3:35 PM: Defendant William S. Dahl in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Per Atty Belville:  Recently appointed and discovery has been received for review.  Counsel intends to investigate a Waupaca Co Case for possible consolidation with Waushara Co.  Defendant is requesting to resolve these matters but additional time is needed for review of discovery.  Court states with all due respect that the Court has been advised for approx the last 2 yrs now that Defendant is wishing to resolve these matters with no resolution.  P/S scheduled - if not resolved at the next hearing the Court will again be scheduling these matters for trial.  Per DA:  Requests the Court address the ongoing competency issue.  Defendant has not engaged with Dr. Berney and the second evaluation has not yet been accomplished.  Atty Belville was not aware that competency was an issue.  She will contact Dr. Berney and advise the Court in writing of the status of his second evaluation.  Court will require that counsel advise the Court no later than 9/20/2017 (one week prior to the next hearing) as to the status of the evaluation.
Defendant's

15CF-67 and 15CF-142 - Both Cases Called @ 1:30 PM: Defendant William S. Dahl in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Only one of the cases was scheduled for today's STC - counsel agree for Court to address 15CF-142 as well today.  Court addresses counsel as to competency issue.  Atty Rashid does not see any need for court to address competency.  Atty Rashid requests second eval be undertaken by Dr. Frank Cummings.  State objected to Dr. Cummings performing second eval.  Atty Rashid confirms that Dr. Cummings can perform said eval and treated as a sub sec (2) eval.  DA has no objection to the Court ordering a second eval but would object to that eval being performed by Dr. Cummings, State believes the appointment should be random and from a neutral detached doctor, not hand picked by defense.  Court notes that Dr. Cummings is not on the independent evalutor listing.  Further argument by Atty Rashid as to second eval - SPD will not pay for the second eval as ordered.  States problems that exist with the first eval of Dr. Collins and believes that Dr. Cummings could provide a sub section (2) eval that is neutral.  Def deserves a fair evaluation.  The Court:  Will order an evaluator off of the independant listing provided - evaluation will be at the County expense.  The Court will advise counsel as to who will provide the evaluation.  Def to comply with the evaluator to get this accomplished as soon as possible.
LETC from Atty Rashid to Judge Slate, Dated 3/15/2017 Re: Competency Evaluation by Dr. Frank Cummings
from Atty Rashid, Dated 2/13/2017 Re: Request for Second Evaluation
Status conference on March 22, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

15CF-67 and 15CF-142 - Both Cases Called @ 1:20 PM: Defendant William S. Dahl in court, in person, with attorney David C. Rashid, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Rashid:  Requests 2nd opinion on NGI be conducted and has confirmed Dr. Cummings would be available for the eval.  State objects to second evaluation and requests matters move forward due to Chapter 950 concerns and the length of time these cases have been pending.  The Court:  Notes NGI issue was discussed early on in these cases.  Grants request for 2nd eval.  Next hearing will be mandatory in person hearing with counsel and Defendant.  Puts Defendant on notice that JT will be scheduled and warns Def that JT will not be adjourned unless good cause can be shown.    DA makes further statement as to appointed examiner and suggests Dr. Collins may be able to do second eval.  Atty Rashid argues against Dr. Collins.  Court notes objection as to examiner and will allow Dr. Cummings to conduct the second eval.  STC scheduled and Court will schedule JT at the next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
From Attorney Rashid to Court

Case Called @ 1:30 PM: Defendant William S. Dahl in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Zilles:  Based upon discussions with the State and his client, resolution cannot be confirmed today and he believes it is appropriate for JT scheduling.  Court will schedule a STC for 7/27/2016 with all PT motions to be filed the day prior.  Court will then discuss further scheduling on 7/27/2016.  Per DA:  Will move to join 2015CF000142.  Motions and Witness Lists to be filed as to both cases.  Per DA:  All offers to resolve are now revoked.  Atty Zilles argues for bond modification as to direct contact with victim.  Victim also present in Court.  DA argues that no contact provisions to remain in place even though conferring with the victim personally.  Court address victim.  Victim requests contact.  The Court:  Advises victim that she is to meet with a counselor and submit the proper proof to the Court.  Upon receipt, Court would consider amending bond conditions to allow for minimal contact for matters regarding the children.  Court will not amend bond further to and until suggested proof submitted for Court's review.  Court notes State's objection to any bond amendment.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
